name: Greek Salad
description: Classic Mediterranean salad with fresh vegetables, feta cheese, and olives. Light but satisfying.

instructions.instruction: Wash tomatoes and cut into large wedges. Place on wide salad platter.
instructions.tip: Tomatoes should be ripe but firm.

instructions.instruction: Wash cucumbers, keep skin on. Cut into thick half-moon slices. Add to platter.
Wash green pepper, remove seeds, slice into rings. Add to salad.
Peel red onion and slice into thin rings. Scatter over vegetables.
instructions.tip: Soak in cold water 5 minutes to reduce sharpness.

instructions.instruction: Place feta block whole in center of salad.
instructions.tip: Traditionally feta is not crumbled - served as block.

instructions.instruction: For dressing: Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper in small bowl.
Drizzle dressing over salad. Mix when serving or let everyone mix their own.

tips: Authentic Greek salad has no lettuce.
Feta cheese is a calcium and protein source.
Olive oil quality directly affects salad taste - use extra virgin.
Serve with crusty bread to soak up dressing.
storageInfo: Store undressed for 1 day in fridge. Keep dressing separate.
servingSuggestion: Serve as side dish or light meal on its own. Pita bread pairs perfectly.
variations: Add grilled chicken or shrimp for protein.
